name: The Chronovore Watch
physical_description: An elegant silver pocket watch. When wound, its hands tick backward, and the date complication counts down. It does not seem to affect local time.
history: The prized possession of a Miskatonic University physics professor who vanished in 1919 after claiming to have 'solved time'.

mechanics.skill_check: Science (Physics) or Mechanical Repair to understand its impossible mechanism.
mechanics.effect: If the watch is allowed to run for more than an hour in one location, time in that area becomes unstable. Objects may briefly appear from the past or future. (e.g., a ghostly image of a former resident, a newspaper from tomorrow).

content_summary: The watch doesn't reverse time; it consumes it, creating a localized temporal paradox.
